summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous relevant resolutions on Iraq, including 986 (1995), 1284 (1999), 1352 (2001), 1360 (2001), 1382 (2001), and 1409 (2002), 
Convinced of the need to continue providing for the civilian needs of the Iraqi people as a temporary measure, 
Noting the Secretary-General's report S/2002/1239 of 12 November 2002, 
Determined to improve the humanitarian situation in Iraq, 
Reaffirming commitment to Iraq's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, 
Decides to extend the provisions of resolution 1409 (2002) until 4 December 2002; 
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
